s: October 18, 2014 - Anyone who has studied the dismal science of economics knows that life moves in cycles. Boom follows bust, dearth follows plenty, and what goes up must come down. Or, as football managers on the…

Of course it is. But people are gullible, and willing to pay for a path to (supposed) easy money. Basically I could get complete authorization from a distributor to resell their products with a written agreement and everything · Yep, since the ‘distributor’ has no authority over the brands.

t: Amazon’s Secret Brands and the Power of Big Tech
s: October 14, 2022 - For Peak Design CEO Peter Dering, Amazon copying big brand shits too close to home. Last year, he discovered that Amazon was selling a bag that was extremely similar to its bestseller called The Everyday Sling Bag. To add insult to injury, the tech company named its invention Everyday Sling.
